name: frit production, for ceramic tile | frit, for ceramic tile | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12079/documentation

This dataset represents the production of frit in 2012. ;;Frit is a ceramic chemicals that have been melted together and cooled rapidly, then ground to a fine powder. They are the main component of nearly all ceramic glazes and are present in many compositions of different materials where a glass faze is needed.;;This dataset is an approximation of frit production. The amount of intermediate exchanges have been calculated based on frit raw materials's composition used in ceramic tiles production. (Nicoletti G.M., Notarnicola B. and Tassielli G. (2002) Comparative Life Cylce Assessment of flooring materials: ceramic versus marble tiles. In: Journal of Cleaner Production). 

 From reception of the reactants at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of frit. Infrastructures are calculated with standard values.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Dataset based on modelling only, therefore data entry is the reference year
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: data represents a rough estimation of the production process
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is based on frit raw materials's composition used in ceramic tiles production.
